cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving north through the Yucatan Channel, then accelerating north-north-east across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the north-eastern Gulf Coast of the U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle / northeastern Gulf Coast (near Apalachicola-Panama City area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No U.S. watches yet – hurricane watch expected later for portions of the northeastern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings limited to western Cuba and the Yucatan (Mexico) coast at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Gulf of Mexico from west-central Florida northward to the Florida Panhandle and Alabama coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–45 kt) are possible at Port Manatee late Tuesday into Wednesday with a 41 % cumulative chance and peak onset probability around Wednesday evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow on the right-hand (eastern) side of Michael could push water 2–4 ft above normally dry ground along the west-central Florida coast, including Tampa Bay and Port Manatee.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may bring 2–4 inches of rainfall with locally higher amounts, producing brief torrential downpours and minor flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Choppy seas and very rough bay/harbor conditions will disrupt vessel movements and cargo operations.
